One Level Up Top Level

ocaml/tools/ci/actions/check-changes-modified.sh - ocaml

  1. #!/usr/bin/env bash
  2. #**************************************************************************
  3. #*                                                                        *
  4. #*                                 OCaml                                  *
  5. #*                                                                        *
  6. #*                 David Allsopp, OCaml Labs, Cambridge.                  *
  7. #*                                                                        *
  8. #*   Copyright 2021 David Allsopp Ltd.                                    *
  9. #*                                                                        *
  10. #*   All rights reserved.  This file is distributed under the terms of    *
  11. #*   the GNU Lesser General Public License version 2.1, with the          *
  12. #*   special exception on linking described in the file LICENSE.          *
  13. #*                                                                        *
  14. #**************************************************************************

  16. set -e

  18. # Hygiene Checks: check that Changes has been updated in PRs
  19. # One of the following must be true:
  20. #   - A commit in the PR alters the Changes file
  21. #   - The no-change-entry-needed label is applied to the PR

  23. API_URL="$1"
  24. shift 1

  26. AUTH="authorization: Bearer $GITHUB_TOKEN"

  28. # We need all the commits in the PR to be available
  29. . tools/ci/actions/deepen-fetch.sh

  31. MSG='Check Changes has been updated'
  32. COMMIT_RANGE="$MERGE_BASE..$PR_HEAD"

  34. LABEL='no-change-entry-needed'
  35. # Check if Changes has been updated in the PR
  36. if ! git diff "$COMMIT_RANGE" --name-only --exit-code Changes > /dev/null; then
  37.   echo -e "$MSG: \e[32mYES\e[0m"
  38. elif curl --silent --header "$AUTH" "$API_URL/labels" | grep -q "$LABEL"; then
  39.   echo -e "$MSG: \e[33mSKIP\e[0m"
  40. else
  41.   echo -e "$MSG: \e[31mNO\e[0m"
  42.   cat <<"EOF"
  43. ------------------------------------------------------------------------
  44. Most contributions should come with a message in the Changes file, as
  45. described in our contributor documentation:

  47.   https://github.com/ocaml/ocaml/blob/trunk/CONTRIBUTING.md#changelog

  49. Some very minor changes (typo fixes for example) may not need
  50. a Changes entry. In this case, you may explicitly disable this test by
  51. using the "no-change-entry-needed" label on the github pull request.
  52. ------------------------------------------------------------------------
  53. EOF
  54.   exit 1
  55. fi
